did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Fredericksburg (Va.) Chamber of Commerce Board of Directors Minutes, 1891-1892

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Fredericksburg (Va.) Chamber of Commerce Board of Directors Minutes, 1891-1892. Local government records collection, Fredericksburg (City) Court Records. The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This item came to the Library of Virginia in a transfer of records from Fredericksburg.
This item is located at the State Records Center. Contact Archives Research Services for access information, directions, and hours.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Fredericksburg, in Spotsylvania County, was named for Frederick Louis, Prince of Wales, eldest son of George II. Fredericksburg was established in 1728, was incorporated as a town in 1782, and became a city in 1879.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Fredericksburg (Va.) Chamber of Commerce Board of Directors Minutes, 1891-1892. The minutes document the founding of the Chamber, the organization of committees, and efforts to lobby the state legislature and U.S. Congress. Topics discussed include railroads, street railroads, and improvements to the river in Fredericksburg. The minute book also contains a newspaper clipping with a transcript of minutes documenting the organization of the Chamber.
